content.description: Start on the blunt arête with your right hand on a blocky hold at the lip of the roof and your left hand on a flat edge three feet to the left.  Campus up to the sloping rail and top out straight up.
content.location: On the left side of the lip of the big roof on the Hero Wall.

content.description: Start on the jugs on the white rock about four feet left of Why.  Campus up and slightly left on good holds.  Top out slightly right.
content.location: Far left on the lip of the big roof on the Hero Wall.

content.description: As far right in the overhang as possible.  Start low in the horizontal below and right of the dark ribs feature.  Climb up through jugs and a massive undercling to a crimp on the second sloping rail.  Move right to meet Poison Ivy and top out.
content.location: Pass the Acorn Boulder and Spy vs. Spy Area.  Look for the big roof with a high dihedral to the right.  "Tank Girl" starts under the overhang to the right of the dihedral.

content.description: Start on the undercling features under Why.  Top out either right or left.
Sit start matched on a low jug.  Move up and left through the sloping rails.  Move right to top out.
content.location: As far right under the roof on the Hero Wall as possible.  The line follows the right side of the large white portion of rock between the large roof and the fallen tree.

content.description: Start on the left side of the roof with hands matched on a protruding horizontal pinch.  Climb straight up through slopers and pockets.
content.location: The first clean line to the left of the big roof on the Hero Wall.

content.description: Same start as Mr. Fantastic. Move up through the horizontals on Mr. Fantastic until you reach the smooth pinch/sloper halfway out the roof.  Follow the holds out left to the massive scary hollow flake.  Traverse the flake until you can reach the lip of the roof to top out on Why Not.
content.location: Under the large roof on the Hero Wall.  Moves left out of the roof for the top out.

content.description: Big moves to big holds; fun roof problem!  Sit start between two boulders on a mondo jug.  Move out through the horizontals.  Pull through the roof on the obvious blocky hold.  Top out straight up.
content.location: Under the big roof on the Hero Wall.  Starts all the way in the back of the roof between two boulders, and moves out of the roof on the right side.

content.description: Start on a left facing sidepull and a right undercling; you may have to stack pads.  Campus straight up, climb through the pockets, and top out straight up.
content.location: On the Hero Wall.  Look to the middle of the face above the deep roof, and start on the lip.

content.description: Start on the lip to the right of the crack under the dihedral.  Work the massive jugs through the dihedral to a smooth (but tight!) top out to the right.
content.protection: pads (bring a few, it may be a V1 but it's tall and balancey)
content.location: The massive dihedral to the right of the even more massive roof on The Hero Wall.

content.description: A variation of Juggernaut.  Start on the jug rail under the ribcage feature to the right of the dihedral.  Work left through the jugs and slopers to meet the dihedral halfway up the wall.
content.location: Starts directly right of the dihedral on the Hero Wall.

content.description: Sit start on the enormous sidepull to the left of the crack.  Climb straight up.  The arête is off.
content.location: The first line on the Hero Wall.  To the immediate left of the fallen tree past the mini-roof, The Flaming Carrot parallels the arete on the dark reddish part of the wall.

content.description: Start low on good holds four inches left of Pinky.  Climb straight up through the brain feature.  Top wherever feels the least sketchy.
content.location: The last clean line on the Hero Wall.  To the left of the roof, look for the large feature reminiscent of a brain halfway up the wall.  "The Brain" starts below this feature.

content.description: The Hero Wall holds most of the developed lines in The Drop.  Reaching higher than 25', the wall offers everything from a juggy dihedral to slabby highballs to long roof problems. Make sure to bring your strong arms and your mantling skills!
